intro: Homotropium erythrorhizum, commonly known as the red-rooted bladdernut, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many acid-loving plants. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its roots are reddish in color, which gives it its common name. The leaves are alternate, elliptical, and have a slightly hairy texture.
